name: Sunset Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice neat, tidy and new motel.
reviews.title: Nice View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic amenities.
reviews.title: Motel a shinning star in an othwise deserted place

reviews.text: Nice view (for Fox) from the back of our room.
reviews.title: Ok...But sorry..I don't rate it !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overpriced for what you get.
reviews.title: spacious and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Fox Glacier at about 1500hrs in the afternoon and went to see Fox and Franz Joeseph Glaciers before booking into our motel. On arrival, I checked in at reception and was informed that our booking was for 2 nights, and we had only requested 1. The guy was very good and said that if we only wanted 1 night there was nothing he could do but let us stay for the one night. Apparently he has a lot of errors with internet bookings, but most of them are caused by the Golden Chain Motel booking system. Rooms were nicely appointed, very clean and well maintained The bathroom was fairly small, but adequate for the purpose. There is no restaurant at this motel, so we ventured up to the township to see what was available. Well, there was not much on offer. There is about 3 or 4 places to eat so we chose the Café Neve as they had a steak on the menu and we love our steaks. The meal was a little while coming, but when it arrived it was presented butterfly’d on a serving of vegetables and was very nice, a bit fancy for me. I thought it was a little expensive, but when I realised where we were, miles from anywhere, then I thought that the price was reasonable. We were lucky that we went to the glaciers in the afternoon as the whole area was fogged in the next morning. We had booked a Helicopter flight, but that had to be cancelled because of the weather. Not happy, but what can you do.
reviews.title: Bit dis

likes.liked: — the SPA tub was very small!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a view. I opened the curtain in the morning and was greeted by the glacier and mountains with Mt Cook in the background. There was no cloud in that direction. It only lasted five minutes but it was definitely a good place to be standing at the time.
reviews.title: What a view

reviews.text: The location is a short way out of town, about 10-15 minutes on foot. The staff were friendly and the place was clean. Upon check in the lady also phoned the glacier guiding people to confirm our start time for the following day. The main reason for people coming to the town is the glacier but the town still remains fairly small with 4 or so restaurants, shop and petrol station. We ate out both nights and the food was good both times even if it did take Café Neve an hour (yes an hour) to make an omelette!
reviews.title: Great location for Fox Glacier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There will be some helicopter noise in the morning but it wasn’t that bad and if you’re sensible you will be on one of these anyway.
reviews.title: Fantastic spot - roomy and airy motel

reviews.text: Basic apartment - quite small but clean. On the outskirts of the town but easy walking distance - and good views of Mount Cook when sky clear. Good place to stay if just stopping over to visit the Glacier. Lots of helicopters buzzing about in the morning.
reviews.title: Great Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sunset Motel was a great place to stay and, we think, one of the better options in a small town. The rooms were clean, comfortable and airy. We stayed in a mountain view room, which was reasonably priced and did have views of the mountains. Mt Cook even dared to show its face more than once! The bed was comfortable and the kitchen fairly well equipped. The bathroom spaciaous and the heated towel rack, a familiar site on our 3 week trip around the South Island, a pleasant little touch. The Motel also has a laundry with washers and dryers that we found very helpful.
reviews.title: Mountain views

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sunset Motel when we visited Fox Glacier on our way to Queenstown. It is one of the best most friendly motels we have stayed in - in the South Island. The rooms are large and well equipped with access to a garden area out the back. Everything is clean are modern.
reviews.title: The Perfect Stop-over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel is 3 mins out of the main town on the way to Lake Matheson - which by the way is a great place for breakfast and dinner.
reviews.title: It was cold!

reviews.text: We were here overnight in November, and it was cold. Though the windows could have given a wonderful view, most of the time the mist was down, and every time it lifted the snow had come further down the mountain. One of the windows in our room was cracked. The best thing to say about this motel is that the receptionist was very pleasant and there is a good laundry. There was a comfortable sofa, but we found the whole place rather basic for our taste. It had all the facilities that you would expect, but somehow they just didn't come up to scratch for us. We stayed in motels in New Zealand that were cheaper than this and which had better furnishings, and fitments, and which were warmer. There was not a lot of privacy, as other guests could be walking past our windows and could look right in if they wished to, but of course without the big windows you wouldn't have the view. We would stay somewhere different if we go to Fox again.
reviews.title: Hospitality tops !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a nice place. We took my in-laws to the Coast for their 80th Birthday treat. The Hosts were great, nothing was too much. They told us the best place to eat and what to see. The Helicopter ride with The Helicopter Line was amazing too. The rooms were clean and compfy, lovely thick white Towels and a view to die for. The whole of the back wall is glass and to wake up in the morning looking at the mountains while having a cup of tea is, wow! You can see the colours changing as the sun moves around. There is also a small area to sit and soak in the place. Lake Matheson is 5 mins drive away, just straight down the road. Will stay again and look forward to seeing it all again.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in Feb - summer so most thngs booked - little choice - room was asic but clean and fine but we had a view over a carpark and the comings and going of all other guests so had to pull curtains to get some p[rivacy as total glass fronted - is a little way out of "town" so had to drive in - its not bad just not that good - I think as so much trade there over summer you cant go wrong as an owner - would try and find somewhere else if was there again - if not all booked up!
reviews.title: roomy, modern rooms with good views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sunset Motel is a nice travel motel just off the main road through Fox Glacier, on the road to Lake Mathieson. We booked a room for the night prior to our glacier hike, and found it to be a lovely stop for the night. Read on for details...
reviews.title: Great jumping off point for fox glacier activities

likes.disliked: — Just a slight bit outside of comfortable walking distance from town

reviews.text: LOCATION:
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean and nice views

likes.liked: — Nice partial view of Mount Cook, good location between Fox Glacier / Lake Matheson.

reviews.title: New, Modest
reviews.text: While a bit beyond easy walking distance from either downtown Fox Glacier (closer) or Lake Mathieson (farther), it's a matter of just a few minutes drive (or bike) from either. Parking in downtown was not an issue during our stay, so having to drive wasn't a problem at all. But if you're in a camper or otherwise opposed to driving to/from the hotel all the time, you'd better have a bike or be prepared for a bit more of a walk than from many of the other area hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS:
reviews.title: Great service, OK room

reviews.text: The room was larger than we'd expected, and well cleaned. We lucked out and had the end unit, so we had large windows facing two directions, with great views. The partial kitchenette was clean, and had an assortment of teas and coffee for the morning. The bathroom was sizable with an ample supply of hot water.
reviews.title: Great motel in Fox Glacier

description: 25 spacious ground floor units.FOUR PLUS STAR qualmark rated in 2008 with views from every room of Mt Cook and Mt Tasman. We have a large back lawn for your enjoyment. Our property is located on Cook Flat Road so we avoid the noise from State Highway 6 that runs through the main town. So no traffic noise or late night bar noise. Sleep in peace with only the views to keep you awake.Studio, Spa and Family units all designated non-smoking, serviced daily, microwave kitchenette with cooking facilities, tea/coffee,32 inch LCD tv's with Satellite television, electric heating , electric blankets, phone, wireless internet available, ironing facilities, cot/highchair available, continental breakfast available, guest laundry, 900 metres to cafes and tour operators. all major credit cards accepted.
